name.text: 8.3.14 (Example of geometric and p series convergence)

questiontext.text:
Example

Use the series tests above to decide if the following series are convergent or divergent.

  1. \(\sum\limits_{n=1}^\infty \frac{1}{8n^3}\).
  2. \(\sum\limits_{n=1}^\infty 24 \cdot 2^{n-1}\)

Solution

  1. In this case we note that \[ \frac{1}{8n^3} = \frac{1}{(2n)^3}, \] so this is a p-series with \(p=3 > 1\) and therefore this series is convergent.
  2. This series is a geometric series with \(r = 2\), therefore it diverges.
